Query: How to send many commands to shell and wait for the command behind ends

Answers.MP Summary: send a signal to a process
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Terminate a program using the SIGHUP (hang up) signal. Many daemons will reload instead of terminating

Top-3 Scripts:
so_1570845: tmp=/tmp/barcode.$$ # Note: security risk
zbarcam > $tmp &
pid=$!
# Sleep until file has content
while [[ ! -s $tmp ]] ; do
    sleep 1
done
kill $pid
cat $tmp

Explanations about Options.-s:
Specify the signal to be sent. The signal can be specified by using name or
 number. The behavior of signals is explained in signal(7) manual page.
